title: U.S. hurdler wins worlds gold as DQ overturned
content: American Rai Benjamin was declared the winner of the 400-meter hurdles at the world championships after officials overrode an initial disqualification for slightly dislodging a hurdle in the lane next to him when he knocked over his own.

title: Witness in 2006 Miami murder case found alive
content: It's unclear how the revelation about witness Paul Conner will affect the murder trial of Rashaun Jones, currently set to start Oct. 6.

title: NFL: Officiate tush push 'tight' after missed call
content: The NFL said the Eagles should have been flagged for at least one false start when they used the tush push against the Chiefs on Sunday and instructed officials this week to call the controversial play "tight."

title: Sources: ACC closing in on new schedule format
content: ACC athletics directors are scheduled to meet Monday in Charlotte to discuss the details of what will either be a move to a nine-game conference slate with one additional Power 4 game required or an "8+2" model.

title: 'We believed it': Fever end playoff series drought
content: The Indiana Fever beat the Atlanta Dream 87-85 to advance to the WNBA semifinals and win their first playoff series since 2015.

title: Kershaw to retire after season: 'The right time'
content: Clayton Kershaw, a three-time National League Cy Young Award winner and 11-time All-Star with the Dodgers, will retire after this season. "I'm at peace with it," he said. "I think it's the right time."

title: Now 0-3, Dolphins battle but refuse moral victories
content: The Dolphins played the heavily favored Bills tough Thursday night but didn't take any pride in losing 31-21.

title: Fried keeps Yankees surging with 13-K showcase
content: Yankees manager Aaron Boone had a blast watching Max Fried deliver a career-high-tying 13 strikeouts in seven scoreless innings Thursday night in a 7-0 win over the Orioles.

content: The exchange between the Atlanta Hawks guard and 12-year NBA pro intensified Wednesday, capped off by a post from the Hawks on Thursday.

content: We break down the major Wrestlepalooza storylines, including John Cena vs. Brock Lesnar and the return of AJ Lee.

content: After a historic summer on the court and massive changes off it, Doncic has sent a message to the NBA. And his new team responded in kind.

content: Half of the semifinal bracket is set. How do Indiana and Las Vegas match up, and which team is the favorite?

content: The Mariners and Astros are about to face off with the division title and playoff seeding on the line. Here's what will determine the race.

content: The NFL trade deadline isn't until Nov. 4, but we're looking ahead. Could Tyreek Hill or Kirk Cousins be moved? Which teams might make deals?

content: The story behind one of college football's most unusual trophies, which is an image of a most unusual animal.

content: One round of Champions League games won't teach us everything we need to know. Reserved reactions are smart, but they're also no fun. Let's overreact!

title: Thompson, Bedard, Keller, others using 4 Nations snubs as Olympic motivation
content: NHL players will participate in the Games for the first time since 2014, with rosters revealed in January.

title: Dalvin Cook meets Caleb Williams? How Tyriq Withers brought Cameron Cade to life
content: Tyriq Withers pulled from his own experience as a walk-on at FSU and working with quarterback guru Jordan Palmer to cultivate his character in the Jordan Peele-produced horror film.

content: Can the Chiefs or Texans turn it around? Do the Bears have a chance in the NFC? Is the season already over for the Giants and Jets?

content: Bobby Marks and Jeremy Woo break down the top five NBA teams with the most future first-round draft picks, from Oklahoma City to Utah.

content: What appeared to be a foregone conclusion in July turned into a hotly contested WNBA MVP race. What changed?

content: In professional wrestling, your signature moves create a foundation for success. Learn more how John Cena, Becky Lynch and other stars perform now.

content: Manchester United, Atl√©tico Madrid and Barcelona are keeping tabs on Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: UWCL draw reaction: Good for Chelsea, Barcelona; bad for Man United; must-see games
content: The Women's Champions League is back! So let's unpack all the must-see games, winners and losers, and talking points from Friday's draw for the 2025-26 league phase.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Who will disappoint? Who is ready to take things to an elite level? Our experts list their picks.

title: Buy the dip: Thirteen players primed for bounce-back seasons
content: These fantasy hockey players underwhelmed last season, but could return to better production this year.

title: Singer Zubeen Garg passes away at 52: PM Modi expresses grief
content: Assam mourns the tragic death of Zubeen Garg, the celebrated singer, who passed away at 52 in a scuba diving accident in Singapore. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma led tributes, lamenting the loss of Assam's favorite son and a cultural icon. Garg, known for his versatility in Assamese, Hindi, and Bengali music, was in Singapore for the North East Festival.

title: 'Silence is acceptance': BJP slams Congress over Pitroda's ‚Äòfelt at home in Pak‚Äô remark
content: BJP on Friday attacked the Congress after Sam Pitroda said he ‚Äúfelt at home‚Äù in Pakistan. BJP spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari called the remark anti-national and insulting to soldiers, alleging Congress has a ‚Äúsoft corner‚Äù for Pakistan. He cited past links with terrorists and accused Rahul Gandhi of silence. The BJP demanded the Gandhi family apologise.

title: 'Keep mutual interests in mind': MEA message to Saudi, Pak; pact raises alarm
content: India acknowledged its extensive strategic alliance with Saudi Arabia, emphasizing its recent strengthening, while commenting on the newly formed Saudi-Pakistan defense agreement. India hopes the partnership respects mutual interests, as the pact sparks speculation about Saudi access to Pakistan's nuclear capabilities amid Middle East tensions. The agreement, uniting Saudi finance and Pakistani military might, raises questions about regional security dynamics.

title: Handshake row gets murkier: PCB responds to ICC; but gets facts wrong
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has responded to the ICC's concerns regarding potential PMOA violations during a recent match. The PCB defended its media manager's actions, claiming authorised access and adherence to ICC protocols, while the ICC raised objections to filming a sensitive meeting and alleged blackmail. The situation remains tense, potentially leading to further action from the ICC.

title: Nvidia-Intel deal: CEO Huang explains $5Bn bet; Eyes PC market expansion
content: In a surprising turn, Nvidia is investing $5 billion in Intel, signaling a strategic partnership. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed confidence in Intel's turnaround, foreseeing a 'fantastic' return. The collaboration involves Nvidia's GPU tech in Intel's AI PCs and Intel's CPUs in Nvidia's data centers. This alliance arrives amid political scrutiny of Intel, potentially aligning Nvidia with U.S.

title: Recession risk high: Moody‚Äôs Zandi warns on US economy; says DOGE
content: Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moody‚Äôs Analytics, suggests the US economy is nearing a recession due to policy missteps and speculative market behavior. Tariffs, immigration restrictions, and Federal Reserve decisions are major headwinds, causing uncertainty and delaying business investments.

title: 'Could've stayed silent': Bremmer praises PM 'defying' Trump; how it had positive impact
content: Ian Bremmer lauded PM Modi's public rejection of Trump's mediation claim during the India-Pakistan escalation, highlighting it as a rare act of defiance. Bremmer noted Modi's direct communication with Putin, despite US tariffs, signaling India's independent foreign policy. He also cautioned about declining Indian trust in the US due to its ties with Pakistan and opportunistic business interests.

title: 86.27m! 'Make sure you finish ahead of Pakistan's Nadeem': Coach to Sachin Yadav
content: Sachin Yadav made a stunning impact at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, securing fourth place with a personal best of 86.27 meters. Despite Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra's eighth-place finish, Yadav's performance, exceeding expectations, has ignited excitement within the Indian athletics community, especially with the upcoming Commonwealth and Asian Games.

title: xAI's final exam: Elon Musk tests loyalty; 24 hours to verdict
content: Elon Musk has requested xAI employees to submit detailed one-page summaries of their past accomplishments and future plans, setting a tight deadline amidst company turbulence. This demand follows Musk's pattern of employee performance reviews across his ventures.

title: 'Wasn't my night': First note for fans! Neeraj opens up on Tokyo disappointment
content: Neeraj Chopra, battling back pain, finished eighth at the World Championships in Tokyo with a throw of 84.03 meters, a disappointing end to his season. Sachin Yadav outperformed him, securing fourth place with 86.27 meters. Keshorn Walcott of Trinidad and Tobago won gold, followed by Anderson Peters and Curtis Thompson.

title: Serena Williams‚Äô net worth 2025: Tennis legacy, deals ‚Äî business ventures grow
content: Serena Williams, a tennis icon, boasts a net worth of $350 million in 2025. Her wealth comes from tennis wins, endorsements, and business ventures. She supports businesses run by women and people of color through Serena Ventures. Recently, she invested in Unrivaled, a women‚Äôs basketball league. Serena also launched a podcast with her sister, Venus.

title: ‚ÄòNo faith in Constitution‚Äô: Fadnavis targets Rahul; terms him 'urban maoist'
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of echoing "urban Maoist" sentiments. Fadnavis alleges Gandhi is inciting Generation Z to overthrow the democratically elected government and disregards the Constitution. This reaction follows Gandhi's renewed allegations of election irregularities and his call for youth to defend democracy, intensifying the political clash between the leaders.

title: Worst-ever! Neeraj Chopra suffers nightmare: Numbers in last 7 years
content: Neeraj Chopra endured his worst finish since 2018, placing eighth at the World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo with a best throw of 84.03m. The Olympic and World Champion, who has consistently medalled at global events over the past seven years, admitted to back issues that hampered his performance. A look at his results since 2018 highlights how rare such an outcome is for India‚Äôs javelin superstar.

title: Asia Cup: Timeline of handshake row - ICC pulls up PCB over PMOA violation
content: The Asia Cup 2025 is embroiled in controversy after India's refusal to shake hands with Pakistan sparked a major standoff. The PCB demanded the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft, delaying a match against the UAE. The ICC accused PCB of protocol breaches, including unauthorised recording within the PMOA.

title: Hair growth tips: Yoga poses that boost scalp blood flow; experts explain how
content: Battling hair thinning or slow growth? Incorporate yoga into your routine! Certain poses boost scalp circulation, delivering vital nutrients to hair follicles. Downward-Facing Dog, Forward Fold, and Headstands are beneficial. Even Fish Pose helps! Combine these with healthy habits for stronger, shinier hair. A few minutes daily can transform your hair care, naturally.

title: Singer Zubeen Garg passes away at 52 in scuba diving accident in Singapore
content: Assamese singer Zubeen Garg tragically passed away at 52 in Singapore due to a scuba diving accident. He was scheduled to perform at the North East Festival. Zubeen was widely celebrated for his contributions to music across various languages, including his Bollywood hit 'Ya Ali'. His sudden demise has prompted an outpouring of grief from fans and prominent figures.

title: Connor McDavid in doubt: Oilers risk it again ‚Äî no long-term deal yet
content: Connor McDavid's future with the Edmonton Oilers beyond 2026 remains uncertain, casting a shadow over the team's Stanley Cup aspirations. McDavid emphasizes his decision hinges on "a feeling," sparking both hope and unease among fans after recent final heartbreaks. With roster questions and goaltending concerns, McDavid's patience depends on management's ability to build a championship-caliber team.

title: 'Was fed up, wanted to take sanyas': Sheena Bora's childhood friend; email texts cited
content: Sheena Bora, allegedly murdered by Indrani Mukerjea, expressed a desire for 'sanyas' due to life's problems, according to a childhood friend's testimony, citing old emails. The friend, a prosecution witness, shared Bora's plans to marry Rahul Mukerjea and her strained relationship with Indrani. Communication ceased abruptly after a text about breaking up with Rahul.

title: Fact check: Are handshakes mandatory in cricket? What does the rulebook say?
content: Former international umpire Anil Chaudhary suggests that the Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) recent controversies during the Asia Cup were a diversionary tactic following their loss to India. These controversies included boycott threats, disputes with ICC match referee Andy Pycroft, and a handshake disagreement with India, sparked by strained relations after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: George Kittle Under Fire: From fake Kirk quote to viral backlash; critics say 'no place in NFL'
content: George Kittle, the San Francisco 49ers' tight end, recently refuted a fabricated quote attributed to him regarding Charlie Kirk and politics in the NFL. Kittle took to Instagram to clarify the misinformation after a Facebook post went viral, emphasizing the importance of verifying information online. He is currently on injured reserve but is expected to return on October 12.

title: 'Ex-PM conveyed gratitude': Yasin Malik's major claim on meeting Hafiz Saeed; calls case 'betrayal'
content: Yasin Malik, jailed JKLF chief, claims he met with Lashkar-e-Taiba founder Hafiz Saeed in 2006 at the request of IB, as part of a backchannel peace process. Malik alleges that then Prime Minister Manmohan Singh expressed gratitude for his efforts.

title: Bengaluru civic apathy continues: Another school van gets stuck in open drain
content: In Bengaluru, a school minivan carrying children got stuck in an open drain on Panathur-Bellandur road, fortunately without injuries. This incident follows a series of accidents on the same stretch, including a school bus partially toppling and other vehicles sinking into slush-filled craters.

title: Stabbed, stripped, extorted: Woman sexually harassed inside B'luru PG; accused arrested
content: A 37-year-old man allegedly stabbed and sexually harassed a 24-year-old woman at a PG in Bengaluru‚Äôs Whitefield, demanding money and transferring  Rs 14,000 from her account. He was later assaulted by PG staff, leading to cross-complaints. Police have arrested the accused, Sai Babu Chennuru, and registered cases of attempt to murder, sexual harassment, extortion, and assault.

title: Man throws chilli powder in his daughter‚Äôs eyes, later stabs her to death
content: In Gwalior's Janakganj, a shocking incident unfolded as Badam Singh Kushwaha allegedly murdered his 24-year-old daughter, Rani Kushwaha. Police reports indicate that Singh, fueled by a long-standing family dispute and alcohol addiction, attacked Rani with chili powder before fatally stabbing her. The mother stated that Rani often objected to his behavior.

title: Zomato delivery boy attacked in Bengaluru over delayed food delivery
content: In Bengaluru's Bapuji Nagar, a Zomato delivery executive was reportedly assaulted by two individuals on September 14 due to a delayed food delivery. The dispute escalated when the order arrived late, resulting in the delivery boy sustaining minor injuries. Police are awaiting a formal complaint from the victim to initiate a full investigation into the incident.

title: Exclusive | Jaismine Lamboria's story: COVID, setbacks to World Champion!
content: Jaismine Lamboria, hailing from Bhiwani, overcame early setbacks, including a disappointing Olympic debut and health challenges, to clinch gold at the World Boxing Championships. Inspired by her family's boxing legacy, particularly her great-grandfather Hawa Singh, she shifted her focus to performance over results.

title: Trump pressure: EU aims to phase out Russia LNG; reluctant to hit India, China with tariffs
content: The European Union is contemplating accelerating its timeline for phasing out Russian liquefied natural gas imports, potentially moving faster than the initially planned 2027 deadline. This consideration follows pressure from the US and is being explored through sanctions and modifications to the RePowerEU plan.

title: Muridke camp 'destroyed': After JeM, LeT commander makes big admission on Op Sindoor - Watch
content: Following India's Operation Sindoor, a Lashkar-e-Taiba commander admitted severe damage to their Muridke headquarters. This admission follows similar revelations from Jaish-e-Mohammed regarding their Bahawalpur base. LeT is now fundraising, allegedly under the guise of flood relief, to rebuild the destroyed Markaz-e-Taiba camp, with Pakistan allocating PKR 4 crore for the project.

title: DUSU 2025: Aryan Maan elected president; ABVP sweeps, NSUI trails
content: Delhi University‚Äôs 2025 DUSU elections concluded with ABVP‚Äôs Aryan Maan winning the President post, while the party secured three of the four key positions. Held on September 18 across 52 centres and 195 booths, the polls saw over 2.75 lakh eligible voters, with a 39.45% turnout. Key issues included campus safety, student welfare, and gender representation, reflecting the growing political engagement of Delhi University students.

title: Pahalgam attack: NIA court extends custody by 45 days; DNA, mobile data reports awaited
content: A special NIA court in Jammu extended the custody of Bashir Ahmad Jothat and Parvaiz Ahmad by 45 days in connection with the Pahalgam terror attack. Arrested in June, they are accused of sheltering Pakistani militants involved in the April 22 attack.

title: Big blow! Trump revokes sanctions waiver - why is Iran‚Äôs Chabahar port important for India?
content: The US has revoked sanctions waivers for Chabahar port, impacting India's trade and strategic ambitions. This move affects India's operation of the Shahid Beheshti terminal, crucial for trade with Afghanistan and Central Asia, and a counter to China's Gwadar Port. The decision poses a setback to India's regional connectivity initiatives.

title: Mysuru Dasara row: SC junks plea over Banu Mushtaq invite; what it said
content: The Supreme Court has upheld the Karnataka high court's decision, allowing Muslim author Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate the state-sponsored Dasara Mahotsav at the Chamundeshwari Temple in Mysuru. The court dismissed an appeal arguing that the inauguration by a Muslim would hurt Hindu religious sentiments. The decision reinforces the secular nature of state events, as emphasized by the Constitution.

title: DUSU polls 2025: ABVP‚Äôs Aryan Maan elected president; NSUI's Rahul Jhansla becomes VP
content: Delhi University Student Union elections saw a calmer polling day with a slight increase in voter turnout, reaching 39.4%. While voting was largely peaceful, the NSUI accused ABVP of vote manipulation, alleging marked EVMs. ABVP refuted the claims, citing NSUI's frustration over their growing popularity. First-time voters expressed hopes for improved campus facilities and affordable transport.

title: Watch: PM Modi plants a Kadamb sapling; King Charles gifted it on his birthday
content: Narendra Modi received a Kadamb sapling from King Charles III. The gift marked Modi's 75th birthday. It also celebrated Modi's 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' initiative. Modi planted the sapling at his residence. Earlier, Modi gifted King Charles a Sonoma tree. The leaders discussed climate, trade, and wellness. The Kadamb tree symbolizes environmental responsibility. This act strengthens UK-India relations.

title: Slaps, punches and pushes: iPhone 17 frenzy turns violent at Mumbai Apple store
content: Enthusiasts in Mumbai and Delhi eagerly awaited the iPhone 17 series launch, causing long queues and a minor scuffle at the BKC Jio Centre. The new lineup, including the iPhone 17 Pro Max, boasts an A19 Bionic chip and enhanced cameras. Some customers, like Irfan, waited overnight for specific models, while others expressed concerns about security amidst the chaos.

title: Karnataka SBI bank robbery: Police recover 6.54 kg gold, ‚Çπ41.04 lakh cash from abandoned get-away car
content: SP Laxman Nimbargi said that the get-away car hit a bike, leading to an altercation between the robbers and residents of Hulajanti village. This accused abandoned the plot and ran away after threatening the villagers with guns and knives.

title: Watch: ‚ÄòLook to the Preamble‚Äô, Supreme Court clears Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate Mysuru Dasara
content: India‚Äôs Supreme Court dismissed a petition challenging Karnataka‚Äôs decision to have Booker Prize-winning author Banu Mushtaq inaugurate Mysuru Dasara on September 22 at Chamundeshwari temple.¬†

title: Enrollment to State board schools in Karnataka declines by over 5 lakh compared to last year
content: According to data, from 2023-24 to 2025-26, encolment decreased by about 7.26 lakh in government schools.

title: In-charge headmaster of panchayat school arrested for assaulting Class 3 boy in Pudukottai
content: Mother too attacked for questioning the headmaster and six persons have been booked under the SC/ST Act

title: Rare surgery performed at KLES hospital
content: Experts at the Department of Neuro and Vascular Interventional Radiology performed a below-knee lithotripsy for peripheral vascular disease

title: Collector outlines plan to boost primary sector in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: Shyam Prasad sets 15% GVA growth target, stressing horticulture expansion, climate-resilient crops, micro-irrigation, and natural farming

title: Dasara holidays for schools in Andhra Pradesh from September 22 to October 2
content: Decision has been taken to this effect after discussing the issue with Education Department officials, says HRD Minister Nara Lokesh

title: Condolences pour in over death of singer Zubeen Garg
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and a host of musicians express condolences over the singer‚Äôs death

title: Elaborate security arrangements will be in place for Dasara
content: ‚ÄòNecessary measures have been taken to not only maintain law and order and ensure no untoward incident takes place at the different venues of Dasara programmes, but also to facilitate smooth movement of traffic in and around the venues‚Äô

title: Navaratri Rangotsava from Sept. 22
content: There will be folk dance troupes performance daily at Vanaranga at 5.30 p.m., while plays will be performed at Bhoomigeetha auditorium at 7 p.m.

title: Writer T. Padamanabhan ridicules circular mandating ‚Äòrespected‚Äô before Ministers‚Äô names
content: The writer was speaking at the inauguration of the ‚ÄòWalk Against Drugs,‚Äô led by Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala in Kannur

title: Temporary bus stands to be set-up to regulate traffic during Dasara
content: Nine bus stands will be established in different areas of the city to cater to suburban and city routes

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Amazon to work with Telangana govt to set up Gig workers‚Äô relaxation centres
content: Godrej to establish new dairy plant; Eli Lilly & Company agreed to set up a manufacturing factory in Telangana

title: WEF president invites Telangana CM Revanth Reddy to next 2025 Davos¬†conclave
content: Mr. Brende promised to visit Hyderabad soon to discuss about the ways for collaboration between the WEF and the Telangana Government

title: India expects Saudi Arabia to keep in mind mutual interests, sensitivities: MEA on Saudi-Pakistan pact
content: India and Saudi Arabia have a wide-ranging strategic partnership that has deepened considerably in the last few years, says External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

title: Chennai conservancy workers‚Äô protest: Madras High Court questions why police are afraid of one-man commission
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava‚Äôs Bench refuses to interfere with constitution of the commission to probe alleged police excesses while quelling the conservancy workers‚Äô protest

title: ‚ÄòMirage‚Äô movie review: Jeethu Joseph drowns us in the mirage of a perfect thriller
content: The absence of a coherent, believable screenplay and the compulsion to deliver one shocking twist after another drains ‚ÄòMirage‚Äô of any impact

title: Hurriyat Conference Chairperson Mirwaiz Farooq claims house arrest, flays authorities
content: The Hurriyat Chairperson earlier stated that he was placed under house arrest on Wednesday (September 17) night after the demise of former Hurriyat Chief Abdul Gani Bhat

title: A.P. liquor scam: SIT questions MP Midhun Reddy on day one
content: Investigation officers took Mr. Midhun Reddy into custody from the central jail, conducted medical check up of the MP at the Government Hospital and brought him to SIT office, located at Vijayawada

title: Rahul Gandhi speaks like an 'urban Maoist': CM Fadnavis on his Gen Z post
content: It is not 'vote chori', but Rahul Gandhi's brain has been stolen. He has no trust in the Constitution and rejects institutions, says Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis

title: Did KCR make MLAs from other parties who joined BRS resign?: Kadiyam Srihari
content: The Station Ghanpur MLA confirmed that he, along with other legislators, had received a letter from the Speaker seeking an explanation

title: What India‚Äôs rich spends on? New wealth report shows Mercedes-Benz,¬†Rolex, Tanishq and more
content: The Mercedes-Benz Hurun India Wealth Report 2025 shows India‚Äôs wealthy households have nearly doubled to 871,700 since 2021, with Maharashtra registering most millionaire households

title: Sharad Pawar calls Maharashtra CM Fadnavis to disapprove of BJP MLA's remarks about NCP (SP) leader Jayant Patil
content: BJP MLA Gopichand Padalkar's made the alleged derogatory comments about senior NCP (SP) leader Jayant Patil's parents at a rally in Jat

title: Taliban Release Detained Elderly British Couple
content: An elderly British couple detained in Afghanistan for almost eight months were released on Friday, the Taliban authorities said, after pressure built to free the pair due to fears over their health.

title: Video: Another School Bus Gets Stuck In Drain In Bengaluru, Second Incident In A Week
content: Just days after a school bus carrying around 20 children nearly toppled while navigating a pothole-ridden stretch of Bengaluru's Balagere Main Road, a second school bus got stuck, bringing renewed focus to the city's worsening road infrastructure.

title: Adani Group Adds Rs 66,000 Crore In Market Cap After SEBI Order
content: Shares in Adani Group companies surged on Friday after markets regulator SEBI cleared the conglomerate of allegations made by US short-seller Hindenburg Research.

title: Rajasthan Government School Teachers Reward Students For Scoring 90%: Air Travel To Daman-Diu
content: In an inspiring example of encouragement, five students from the Government Higher Secondary School in Rajasthan were recently taken on an air journey to Diu-Daman, a reward for scoring above 90% in their Class 12 board exams.

title: Poll Panel On Cleanup Mode, 808 Inactive Political Parties Delisted
content: The Election Commission of India has stepped up its efforts to remove inactive political parties from its records. The Commission has delisted 808 Registered Unrecognised Political Parties that have not contested elections in 6 years.

title: Bodies of 2 Girls Found In Well In Jharkhand, Probe Underway: Cops
content: The bodies of two schoolgirls were found in a well in Jharkhand's Giridih district, police said on Friday.

title: On Rahul Gandhi's Message To Gen Z, Devendra Fadnavis' "Urban Naxal" Jab
content: Rahul Gandhi's post on Gen Z and vote theft has infuriated the BJP, which has been heaping criticism on the senior Congress leader.

title: Amid Protests For Electoral Reform, Will Bangladesh Vote In February?
content: Ahead of elections in Bangladesh next year, an alliance of hardline Islamic parties is hitting the streets posing a fresh challenge to Bangladesh's fragile law and order situation.

title: After 39 Years, Chhattisgarh High Court Acquits Man In Rs 100 Bribery Case
content: The Chhattisgarh High Court has delivered a landmark verdict, underscoring the principle that justice may be delayed, but it is never denied.

title: Baby Dies After Ambulance Stuck 5 Hours In Mumbai-Ahmedabad Highway Jam
content: A 16-month-old boy died on Thursday after the ambulance carrying him was stuck for over five hours in a traffic jam on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway.

title: Madhya Pradesh Government Hospital Sent Body Home In A Garbage Trolley
content: The body of a murder case victim was sent home after post-mortem in a trolley vehicle, which is otherwise used to collect garbage, of the Nagar Palika Parishad (a civic body), in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh, spotlighting the callousness of the authorities

title: "I Got Only 4": Gujarat Woman Blocks Road After Fight With Golgappa Seller
content: In most cities, traffic is disrupted by processions, political rallies, or the occasional monsoon downpour. In Gujarat's Vadodara this week, the culprit was golgappas, the popular street food.

title: Drunk Man Bites Off Snakes Head After Attack In Andhra Pradesh, Sleeps Beside It
content: In a bizarre act of revenge, aman allegedly bit off the head of a venomous snake after it attacked him in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati district.

title: Opinion: Opinion: GST Cut, Inflation Under Control: Optimism As Festival Season Approaches
content: Away from politics, floods, rain-related tragedies and the Trump tariffs, there is optimism in the air. With GST rationalized, inflation in control, the upcoming festival season promises good times.

title: From 'Felt At Home In Pakistan' To ''84 Mein Hua To Hua,': Sam Pitroda's 7 Remarks That Created Controversies
content: Congress leader Sam Pitroda is once again under fire for his remarks after he urged the Centre to prioritise dialogue with neighbouring countries and said that India's foreign policy should begin by strengthening ties with Pakistan

title: Meet Robin, Robot That Acts Like 7-Year-Old To Help Patients In Hospitals
content: Days after Meagan Brazil-Sheehans 6-year-old son was diagnosed with leukemia, they were walking down the halls of UMass Memorial Childrens Medical Center when they ran into Robin the Robot.

title: West Bengal Gears Up For Voter Roll Revision, 2026 Poll Preparation Begins

content: In yet another tough move against India, the Donald Trump administration in the United States has announced the revocation of its waiver of sanctions over the strategic Iranian port of Chabahar, granted in 2018.

title: Telangana‚Äôs rural women redefine ambition, drive change and prosperity
content: Women self-help groups seem to be rewriting the rules of rural enterprise. From running kirana shops and small canteens to managing fuel stations and leasing buses to the State-run road transport corporation, they are scaling ambitious heights under the Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty. With solar power units on the horizon, these women from economically disadvantaged backgrounds are now earning profits, respect and breaking deep-rooted patriarchal barriers, writes¬†P. Laxma Reddy
